summary: This is a business record certification from Municipal Credit Union, submitted in response to a subpoena duces tecum. It certifies the accuracy and completeness of financial records produced, specifically noting that checks, credit card statements, and other documents were provided, but that Suspicious Activity Reports and Currency Transaction Reports are not included and will be handled separately by the BSA Department.

persons.name: Clyde Washington
persons.context: Appears as the notary public who administered the oath for the certification document.

persons.name: Danielle Jones
persons.context: Identified as a duly authorized custodian of records for Municipal Credit Union who is certifying the accuracy and completeness of documents produced in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Patricia Gonzalez
persons.context: Listed as the notary public who notarized the document, with her commission number and expiration date provided.

connections.description: Danielle Jones is identified as a custodian of records authorized to act on behalf of Municipal Credit Union.

locations.description: Address for Municipal Credit Union as listed on the document.
Location where notary public Patricia Gonzalez is qualified to practice.

keyFacts: Municipal Credit Union produced financial records including checks and credit card statements in response to a subpoena duces tecum.

The certification explicitly states that the produced records do not contain Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) or Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs), which will be handled separately by the BSA Department.
The document is a formal business record certification pursuant to C.P.L.R. 3122-a, indicating it was part of a legal discovery process.
